content.title: Greedy Choice Lemma
content.body: When we select a vertex with minimum distance from the priority queue, that distance is the true shortest path distance.

Assume for contradiction that when we extract u, there exists a shorter path. This path must go through some unvisited vertex w. But dist[w] >= dist[u] by the greedy choice, creating a contradiction since edge weights are non-negative.
